results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:2. Eps. 05-08
results.creator_credit: Noriko Kobayashi, Yutaka Sugiyama, Hideaki Anno, Gainax, Project EVA and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. In this instalment, the young pilots must overcome their personal conflicts, in order to stave off the enemy. This disc, Collection 0:2, contains episodes 5-8.

results.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection 0:1. Eps. 01-04
results.creator_credit: Noriko Kobayashi, Yutaka Sugiyama, Hideaki Anno, Gainax, Project EVA and TV Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Neon Genesis Evangelion Collection”.
Set in 2015, in a post-holocaust world, with half the population annihilated, this made for television animated series mixes science fiction, action, mystery and adventure with humour. Evangelion is the name of the most powerful combat weapon ever made by man, but one that requires a young human pilot to manipulate it. As the human race cowers in subterranean cities, a deadly war is raged between survivors and the mysterious beings known as Angels. As the Angels and the Evangelions engage in deadly battle, the mystery of why the earth was attacked remains unsolved. This disc, Collection 0:1, contains episodes 1-4. Also available on VHS [309090].

results.title: Nenette and Boni [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Claire Denis, Georges Benayoun, Canal+, Centre National de la Cinematographie, Dacia Films and La Sept Cinema
results.brief_description: Set among Marseilles’ working class, Claire Denis’ “Nenette and Boni” is a coming-of-age film about a brother and sister who learn to make peace, forming a meaningful relationship out of dire circumstances. Nineteen year-old Boni finds release from his ennui with erotic writings - obsessive detailed accounts of his desires for a married woman. Boni is perturbed by the arrival of his little sister, Nenette, a teenager who is pregnant and in need of his support. Nenette and Boni have been estranged since the divorce of their parents, having lived separately for many years, and their reunion is fraught and even violent, filtered through the pain of their parents’ relationship. As the pregnancy continues Boni becomes increasingly engaged by the idea of the baby, whilst Nenette remains hostile to the idea of motherhood. This film contains some sublimely textural moments focusing on the patterns of the ordinary, cast as beautiful visions that contrast to the drab surrounds of the protagonists’ milieu, even if Denis does at times fail to provide expositional detail that explains the characters’ emotional journey. Winner of top honours at the 1996 Locarno Film Festival and atmospherically scored by the Tindersticks. Cast includes Gregoire Colin, Alice Houri, Valeria Bruni-Tedeschi, Vincent Gallo and Jacques Nollot. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Nelli Kim
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Jacques Bobet and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Member of the Soviet Union’s women’s gymnastic team at the 1976 Olympic Games, Nelli Kim was 17 when she won two gold medals for her superb performance on the horse vault and for the floor exercises. The slow-motion camera highlights the best moments of her performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Georges Dufaux, Jacques Bobet and ONF | NFB

results.title: Nell and Fred
results.creator_credit: Richard Todd, Colin Lun, George C. Stoney and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Penetrating look at an issues that confronts many people when age and infirmity make them vulnerable. Nell and Fred must choose between doing for themselves or moving under the restrictive car of an old folks home. Their decision will arouse sympathy and understanding.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Todd, Colin Lun, George C. Stoney and ONF | NFB

results.title: Neighbours = Love your neighbour
results.brief_description: A parable in which two men, neighbours, quarrel about a flower that springs up exactly over the boundary line that divides their gardens. The quarrel grows intensely fierce, each liquidates the other’s family and finally each other. The final scene shows their adjoining graves above which the flower grows again. In this film McLaren has used his “pixillation” technique in which the principles of animation, normally used to put drawings or puppets into motion, are used to animate the lives of human beings. The film has neither dialogue nor commentary, the visuals being accompanied by synthetic music, drawn directly on the film base, and sound effects.

results.title: Negotiation for positive results
results.brief_description: A training video with accompanying trainer’s manual that provides techniques to aid people in the workplace in developing a positive and bias-free approach to negotiation. The program takes participants through the steps necessary for a thorough approach to negotiation, a process that considers both parties in arriving at a result of mutual benefit. It stresses the need to consider the environment in which negotiations take place, and to ensure that all elements of prejudice are put aside.

results.title: Negotiating a new Canadian constitution
results.creator_credit: Gordon Payne, John Taylor, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A visually fascinating and mildly ironic look at the Canadian people, this three-minute film is an animated version of a poem by Lionel Kearns. It is experimental in nature and well-stocked with brilliant graphics and an unusual sound track.

results.title: Negotiate like the pros. Vol.2
results.brief_description: Never pay too much, settle for too little or give in too soon again! This seminar presentation by John Patrick Dolan shows the tactics and countertactics of effective negotiations, such as why silence is such a powerful tool, how to use and respond to the “wince” tactic, and simple ways to defuse emotional outbursts and disarm hostile attacks!
